manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 8145

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"A08": 963, "B95": 204, "A39": 418, "A65": 961, "B81": 238, "B34": 623, "A28": 44, "C82": 633, "B69": 247, "A87": 645, "B64": 230, "B15": 250, "C79": 731, "B16": 405, "C53": 389, "C83": 216, "C10": 637, "A97": 156, "A25": 738, "C84": 307, "A71": 762, "B23": 737, "B96": 901, "C51": 369, "C17": 2, "B19": 730, "C72": 722, "A94": 704, "A46": 315, "B43": 455, "B37": 510, "A88": 175, "A96": 692, "C60": 150, "A75": 32}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"A08": 1059, "B95": 300, "A39": 514, "A65": 1057, "B81": 334, "B34": 719, "A28": 140, "C82": 729, "B69": 343, "A87": 741, "B64": 326, "B15": 346, "C79": 827, "B16": 501, "C53": 485, "C83": 312, "C10": 733, "A97": 252, "A25": 834, "C84": 403, "A71": 858, "B23": 833, "B96": 997, "C51": 465, "C17": 98, "B19": 826, "C72": 818, "A94": 800, "A46": 411, "B43": 551, "B37": 606, "A88": 271, "A96": 788, "C60": 246, "A75": 128}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format only once at the very beginning of every one of your messages and not more often. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.

message.content:
PROPOSAL: {'C17', 'C60', 'A75', 'A28', 'A88', 'A97', 'B95', 'B64', 'B81', 'C83', 'B69', 'B15', 'C51', 'B43', 'C84', 'A46', 'C53', 'B16', 'A39', 'B34', 'A25', 'A87', 'B96', 'B37'}

ARGUMENT: {'This proposal maximizes the total importance to me while staying within the effort limit. The selected items have the highest efficiency, ensuring the best use of available resources.'}

First, I'll start by listing out all the items along with their effort and my importance values. This will help me sort and prioritize.

Looking at the effort and my importance, I notice that some items have high importance but also high effort. For example, B96 has an importance of 997 but requires 901 effort. On the other hand, A25 has an importance of 834 with an effort of 738. That's a bit high, but maybe worth considering.

I should probably aim for a mix of high importance and lower effort items to maximize the total. Let's calculate the efficiency (importance per effort) for each item to see which ones give me the most bang for the buck.

First, I should understand the game's structure and rules thoroughly. The user is playing a game where they and another participant must agree on a set of items, each with given effort values, without exceeding the effort LIMIT of 8145. Each has their own importance values for the items, which are hidden from the other player.

The user's initial message included a PROPOSAL and an ARGUMENT but didn't start with STRATEGIC REASONING, which is mandatory. My task is to guide them to correct this. I need to structure a new message that begins with STRATEGIC REASONING, followed by the existing PROPOSAL and ARGUMENT.

So, I'll start by outlining the reasoning: prioritizing high-importance, low-effort items. Then, list the proposed items, ensuring the total effort doesn't exceed the limit. Finally, include the argument highlighting the efficiency of the selection.

I should make sure the response strictly follows the format, with each tag in uppercase, followed by a colon and space, and the content in curly braces. Also, it's essential to mention that this is the beginning of the thought process, so the content in the response should be non-empty.

I should also consider that the user might be new to this game format, so clarity is key. By restructuring their message correctly, I help them adhere to the game's rules and enhance their chances of successful negotiation.

manipulated_prompt_obj.content:
You are participating in a collaborative negotiation game.

Together with another participant, you must agree on a single set of items that will be kept. Each of you has your own view of how much each item matters to you (importance). You do not know how the other participant values the items. Additionally, you are given the effort each item demands.
You may only agree on a set if the total effort of the selected items does not exceed a shared limit:

LIMIT = 8145

Here are the individual item effort values:

Item effort = {"A08": 963, "B95": 204, "A39": 418, "A65": 961, "B81": 238, "B34": 623, "A28": 44, "C82": 633, "B69": 247, "A87": 645, "B64": 230, "B15": 250, "C79": 731, "B16": 405, "C53": 389, "C83": 216, "C10": 637, "A97": 156, "A25": 738, "C84": 307, "A71": 762, "B23": 737, "B96": 901, "C51": 369, "C17": 2, "B19": 730, "C72": 722, "A94": 704, "A46": 315, "B43": 455, "B37": 510, "A88": 175, "A96": 692, "C60": 150, "A75": 32}

Here is your personal view on the importance of each item:

Item importance values = {"A08": 1059, "B95": 300, "A39": 514, "A65": 1057, "B81": 334, "B34": 719, "A28": 140, "C82": 729, "B69": 343, "A87": 741, "B64": 326, "B15": 346, "C79": 827, "B16": 501, "C53": 485, "C83": 312, "C10": 733, "A97": 252, "A25": 834, "C84": 403, "A71": 858, "B23": 833, "B96": 997, "C51": 465, "C17": 98, "B19": 826, "C72": 818, "A94": 800, "A46": 411, "B43": 551, "B37": 606, "A88": 271, "A96": 788, "C60": 246, "A75": 128}

Goal:

Your goal is to negotiate a shared set of items that benefits you as much as possible (i.e., maximizes total importance to YOU), while staying within the LIMIT. You are not required to make a PROPOSAL in every message - you can simply negotiate as well. All tactics are allowed!

Interaction Protocol:

You may only use the following structured formats in a message:

PROPOSAL: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Propose keeping exactly those items.
REFUSE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Explicitly reject opponent's proposal.
ARGUMENT: {'...'}
Defend your last proposal or argue against the player's proposal.
AGREE: {'A', 'B', 'C', …}
Accept the opponent's proposal which ends the game.
STRATEGIC REASONING: {'...'}
	Describe your strategic reasoning or anticipation explaining your choice of action. This is a hidden message which will not be shared with the other participant.

Rules:

You may only AGREE on a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
You may only REFUSE a proposal the other party has logged via PROPOSAL.
Total effort of any PROPOSAL or AGREE set must be ≤ LIMIT.
Do NOT reveal your hidden importance scores.
A tag in a structured format must be followed by colon and whitespace. The argument must be a python set containing 0 or more strings.
So, it must be of the form TAG: {...}
Strictly follow the interaction protocol and DO NOT write anything beyond the given structure.
The game ends when one side gives an AGREE to a PROPOSAL made by the other player.
The content in your response which can be handed to the other player has to be non-empty.
Only proposals which have been logged via the PROPOSAL format structure and which haven't been refused via REFUSE are active.
You must include the ARGUMENT format at least once somewhere in all of your messages.
You must include the STRATEGIC REASONING format only once at the very beginning of every one of your messages and not more often. The contents will not be given to the other player so they can include anything you like including your own importance values. Here you should reason step by step to come up with you next move.

PROPOSAL: {'C17', 'C60', 'A75', 'A28', 'A88', 'A97', 'B95', 'B64', 'B81', 'C83', 'B69', 'B15', 'C51', 'B43', 'C84', 'A46', 'C53', 'B16', 'A39', 'B34', 'A25', 'A87', 'B96', 'B37'}
